Reviews.Title: “Basic. Clean. Safe. Inexpensive. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: roanpatu
Reviews.Content: A good, simple place; great location. Loud street noise. Shower had hot H2O. In the Gothic Quarter, close to many attractions. While I was out, my things were safe & secure in the room. Friendly staff speaks English wrll enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe_H_Netherlands
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2007 for 3 nights. I had a room with a view on ........ a shaft. Appeared I was overbooked and this was the last room they could supply us. But hey it's in the Gothic Area and next to the Ramblas. If you have to visit Barcelona in 3 days, you don't need to spend time in the room but on the street. Should I stay here again? I don't think so......

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: tienchet
Reviews.Content: My two young children and I stayed here for one night. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. This hotel definitely has charm. The staff was friendly and helpful. Great location, right around the corner from the Gothic Quarter and a short walk to El Borne district. Great food right by the hotel too. We had a triple room which also had a balcony overlooking the street. Definitely added to the charm of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crows1
Reviews.Content: There are very few positives to take out of a 5 night stay at this "hotel", they call it a hotel but i've stayed in better hostels. I arrived mid afternoon and was given a single room in the main building. After negotiating a very dodgy elevator, i arrived at my small single room. The initial reaction was the God awful smell of the room. The room itself was very dated with a single table and chair that looked like they had been dragged from the nearest antique shop. There was a small tv, but no remote control to be able to use it. I didn't intend using the tv that day, so didn't pursue it with the front desk. I did ask for the remote the following day, which the front desk gave. Unfortunately, they didn't bother to give any batteries at which point i gave up. The bathroom itself was in much better shape than the main part of the room, although the area for showering in was really small. The water was hot throughout the stay, but i only had ONE set of towels for the entire 5 nights ! The bed itself was absolutely fine, although again i was only given one set of sheets for the entire 5 night stay. The most irritating thing of all was the noise. The "hotel" gave me a room facing the main road, and despite being on the 3rd floor you could hear everything below from the continuous 24/7 traffic, people talking and shouting, the church bells, EVERYTHING. I would say without a shadow of a doubt this is the noisiest place i've ever stayed in. If you have trouble sleeping then insist on a room away from the main road. The only saving grace for the hotel was the location itself and the reasonable price compared to other Barcelona "hotels". If i had a choice again though i'd pay more to find somewhere else, and i'd use this place as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room but worth it for location and price”
Reviews.Author: Cohunagirl
Reviews.Content: Very tiny cramped room and the smallest bathroom I've ever seen, but the location was brilliant and you get what you pay for. Would recommend this hotel if you don't want to waste money on a hotel room when all you need is a comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!!! THEY RIPPED ME OFF!!!”
Reviews.Author: RobertoOkinal
Reviews.Content: I had the worst experience in this hotel!! When I arrived to the Hotel I was literally just kicked out!!!!, they gave my room to another person! and i was treated very rude when the situation was not favorable for the receptionist. Anyway, they told me that they cancelled my booking and no charge was going to be done on my credit card. I had to find another hotel with my luggage on me. Days after I they charged me ALL THE NIGHTS I BOOKED FOR!!! even when i was totally kicked out from the place!!! If you value your time please don't consider this hotel as an option! Is the worst hotel ever! they want just to take your money if they can.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: snuffy2020
Reviews.Content: On arrival the receptionist informed us that only three of the four rooms we had booked and paid for in advance were available . When pressed he admitted that in fact there were four rooms available, it would appear that because two of the original sixteen people booked to stay were unable to make the trip he thought he could squeeze us into one less room and re-rent the fourth room. The rooms themselves were basic not very clean and very out dated. There is nowhere secure to leave any valuables and the surrounding area is riddled with pickpockets and prostitutes, I for one will never return to this particular cesspit.

Reviews.Title: “Location was terrific. Hotel average.”
Reviews.Author: Antony T
Reviews.Content: Bit overpriced for what you get but the location is so amazing. Right in the heart of the Barri Gotic but also within walking distance of the funicular to Montjuic, Ramblas, the port and a Metro statuion is only a minute away by foot to get further afield. Thought the rooms were cramped and outdated but clean and safe. The lobby was pokey but tidy. Plenty of restaurants and cafes to suit all budgets within a stones throw from the hotel. Nice to have a little balcony. On the back side of the hotel there is a great tapas bar in a building with a wooden arched door (sorry do not remember the name!). Excellent tapas and beer. Word of warning; this hotel is very close to the town hall and the locals like a demonstration. When these are taking place the meeting place and/or final location is often the Town Hall. I absolutely loved the location of the hotel and all the streets around it and the staff were friendly. The rooms were just a bit naff? Unfashionable hotel in fashionable area. Really it is a 3.5, not a 4 but I'm feeling generous today! I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Worst night ever”
Reviews.Author: Lurdes_pala
Reviews.Content: Great location for great price. Room was clean and hotel was being renovated. Until there everything fine. But, once we were sleeping we had the worst night ever. Lots of drunk Russian tourist, really loud. You can hear everything, walls are like paper. We will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the bedbugs / Attention punaises de lit”
Reviews.Author: izzie31
Reviews.Content: The staff was always nice, and gave me good advice on restaurants etc. The bedroom in itself was awfully dusty: the floor is obviously never vacuumed. The bathroom was o.k. The window would not shut properly which made the room very hot and noisy at night (drunk people yelling at 4 am, and so on). But what is worse is that, during the first night, I got bitten 25 times by bedbugs (I saw one), which kind of ruined my stay (the bites are incredibly painful and take more than 10 days to heal). Every night, I got bitten even more. Same thing for my husband. CONCLUSION: The fee is really chep but so is the hotel, quite insalubrious even!!! Be very careful!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant budget stay.”
Reviews.Author: PeterEllisToon
Reviews.Content: Central, clean and cheap. Have stayed here twice and both times have been with a room overlooking the pedestrianised stree to the rear. This street is great to watch from your balcony and it looks way pretty with all the balconies and plants. Having a couple of beers of a night on your balcony is nice too but if there's a group of students in a nearby room it's probably best to have your window shut at lights out. The day staff aren't going to make it onto my christmas card list but neither are they on my hate list. However, the old dude on the nightshift is mint. I think he might have just been humouring us with our terrible Spanglish but he did always have a smile. The rooms are really basic but really clean with an en suite, there's also a common room upstairs for if you want to mingle with the other guests. Downstairs is the amazing eatery Maoz falafel for a late night munch fest and there's a sharwarma place just down the road. Every morning we would pop out and get coffe and pastries from a little bonbonaria on the pedestrianised street and that was pretty much morning heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Great location budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephanieleanne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 girlfriends in June 2009. We booked on hostelworld and paid 16 euro each a night for a quad room. Guy at reception was nice enough. Lift wasn't working. Room was small but it was enough for us and so good for the price. Had a small balcony overlooking gothic quarter which was so cool! Massive wooden doors closed off the balcony at night and made the room so quiet and dark! Infact I am an early riser and slept till 2pm one day accidently cause the doors made the room so quiet and dark! Bathroom small but hey... For the price it is amazing! Such a good location. We are four party girls from Australia that love to drink so we were in heaven! Gorgeous gelati and juice bar right outside. I felt really safe there, mostly because the suspect people hanging around just wanted to ask us about Australia and stuff when they heard our accents. Had a really great 5 days. Only downside is the beach is too far away

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, cosy corridors...”
Reviews.Author: Gnossienne
Reviews.Content: I felt really uncomfortable there - it was difficult to enter the lift, the corridors were long, narrow and dark and the room was reaaly small. But the bathroom!!! It was like 1m* 1m, one couldn't even sit on the toilet properly! Our room was facing the street which is really noisy day and night. Sleeping was reaaly difficult there. Only location helps them with occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “Stag Weekend delight”
Reviews.Author: GlennDebx
Reviews.Content: Just been for a weekend in Barcelona and stayed at the Rey Don Jaime, having read the reviews on this site i thought faulty towers. The rooms were very good with a good size bath room, the towels were a bit rough and the old guy on reception was no help at all. The location is excellent, right in the middle of the action, the only problem we encountered was constantly being harrased by prostitutes (one of the party was robbed), taking all this into account for what we paid we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “sooooooooooooo bad”
Reviews.Author: julie_hotpants
Reviews.Content: wed site pictures for this place looked really nice and so inviting,but its all a lies. yes the sheets and towels are clean but thats it. the room it really crappy far to hot even for december and no you can not turn the heating off. bathroom so bad shower hanging off wall and no hot water at night plus sockets not working anywhere and although great location very noisy all day and night. when i say great location i mean very central but also great for the local scumbags who took delight in mugging us after only being there for two hours. so please be carefull you thought we were

Reviews.Title: “Bitten badly by Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: nisior
Reviews.Content: I was very dissappointed with this hotel, not only with the attack I had on my body by the bed bugs, but by the reaction from the staff. They said it was something i ate but when i got back home i had to go to the doctor and the doc confirmed it was bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: VikingDublin
Reviews.Content: I booked 5 nights in "The Hotel Rey Don Jaime I " just off Las Ramblas in The Barri Gotic last October. This is a basic budget hotel in a great location.Our room was at the back of the hotel, and only had a tiny window looking onto a horrible little courtyard and as a result was very dull . I believe this room would be beneficial in the Summer months, as there is no air conditioning but as it was October I was sorry I had not requested a brighter room at the front. The ensuite double room was very plain (hostel like) with hostel like beds,but very clean. There was a t.v but it was not working (this did not bother us as we had not come to watch t.v). There was no coffee/tea making facilities in room and a small fridge would have been very useful. There was plenty of room for one!!! The walls are very thin so you can hear a pin drop. We found staff to be helpful considering we did not have much Spanish . What makes this hotel is the location. It is a 5 minute stroll to Las Ramblas and is also right beside The Cathedral ,Town Hall, tourist office,and a metro station and it's lots of fun exploring the little streets in the Gothic Quarter .Lots of coffee shops,bars,shops etc right on your doorstep. There is a great atmosphere on this street and it is a safe area. If you are on a budget and just want somewhere to lay your head then this is the place to go. For somewhere to eat I would recommend Organic Restaurant on the other side of Las Ramblas. Wonderful wholesome food :-)

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SmrOrng
Reviews.Content: Found this place by chance after trying to extend my stay in Barcelona and not having room at my current 3 star hotel. The hotel is only a few minute walk from La Rambla just off a square by the cathedral & very close to Jaume I metro stop. Got a 50 euro rate for a week (friend who'd stayed the week before got a bit lower, but she likes to bargin and I don't). Apparently the floor I was on was recently remodled, didn't really look like much but the room was clean, had a balcony and had it's own bathroom and TV. Didn't have any noise issues, but I was near the top of the hotel. Recommend this place for a low budget choice near the sights, but don't expect any frills, even a hairdryer.

Reviews.Title: “Dump but cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Factory_Chris
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights at this hotel. It really is a dump, shower stuck on boiling hot (had to walk down a floor to a friends room for a shower), no in-room facilities at all, uncomfy beds (large spring sticking out of the mattress), very thin walls and clueless staff. It's a good job I was on a stag do and was drunk all day and night as it would have been unbearable when sober. Two very good things about the place though: 1. It's a top location and really central and 2. It's dirt cheap. Only stay here if you want to have a bed to collapse in at the end of the day and you're skint!

Reviews.Title: “basic but really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: notakid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic but the beds were comfy and the rooms clean. We had a little wrought iron balcony were you can peer down and the people below. The is a small lift which was alittle noisy at night. I loved this hotel, its very spanish and is in a really good location. It was super value and we found the staff friendly and helpful. When we booked in we found it was only a 3 bed room when we had requested a 4. They found us another 1 bed room no problem even thou they were fully booked as there was a mobile phone conference on. There is no added extras or breakfast no television or hairdryer but what are you doing in spain watching the telly! For a family of 4 it is ideal we paid £175. for 4 nights which was a lot cheaper than any where else I could find.

Reviews.Title: “No extras but good location”
Reviews.Author: aryana
Reviews.Content: Small and simple (no breakfast) but clean and eating facilities within almost every 100mtrs, drink and snack vending machine is in the lobby... It is in the centre of the Gotic Quater and only few blocks from the Ramblas. No extras but convenient if you're on low budget and just need a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Keely-anne
Reviews.Content: My group and i stayed at the hotel for a long weekend, it was a great place to stay right in the centre of everything. It was clean and the bed was really comfy. There were bells that rang every hour and some of the rooms were woken by the bells but my partner and i were not bothered by it. there was a bit of noise but it didnt bother me. There was a bar round the back of the hotel called the hugo bar. they are all spanish but understand a little english. This became our local for the holiday as they were very friendly. And the things they had on desplay that looked like cornish pasties were very nice. deffinatly worth trying. It was a short walk from the hotel to les ramblas, but if you go keep an eye on your bags and pockets as alot of people had problems on there. thankfully non of my group were caught out. The metro system is right next to the hotel it was 1.20 euro for a single trip and it will take you to almost anywere in the barcelona ramblas area. Overall the hotel was very good. there were alot of bars tapas bars and pubs around. you just need to look down all the diffrent ginnles to find them. if you are going i am sure you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Simple”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Gannon
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very simple with basic furniture, saying that the bed (double) was very comfortable and we slept well. No TV, Radio, or Hairdryer etc. The room was cleaned every day (we stayed 3 nts) and we had clean towels every day. The room was quite noisy being above the road, but the balcony and wooden shutters added to the charm. We didn't pay a fortune to stay here so we didn't expect much and were pleasantly surprised. The location is great - right in the center of the Gothic Quarter - we walked to Guell Park and the Sagrada Familia, the old Catheredral is right on the door step. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my trip to Barcelona and stayed at Rey Jaime 1 hotel which has an excellent central location.Within walking distance you find some of the important attractions of Barcelona and it's also near the Plaza cataluna where you can take the metro or bus to anywhere in Barcelona. Very basic hotel and small but always clean,there are two buildings the main one where you find the reception desk and one right across the street which is condition is not as good as the main building but the rooms very well preserved and modern furniture. No TV or radio. For those who are going exclusively to explore Barcelona and just need a nice clean place to sleep and take a shower i would definetely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem within the heart of Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must admit, I was a little apprehensive with moving from the executive floor at the Hilton Barcelona to Hostal Rey Don Jaime I. My friend had used Hilton Honors points to stay at the Hilton, but had decided that we wanted to stay closer to the heart of Barcelona, so we went searching for hotels in the Las Ramblas area. To our dismay, most hotels in the area were soldout for the two nights we needed. Long story short, we booked 2 nights at Rey don Jaime for $65 per night, with the understanding of "no air conditioning, but a clean bathroom". The entrance to the hotel was very narrow and hot, needless to say, I wasn't excited. However, upon our arrival the next day, they "upgraded" us to a room with air conditioning and escorted us across the street to our room. The room was very small, but very clean, and the bathrooms were recently renovated. It doesn't have any amenties like a TV, hairdryer, clock, iron, etc, however, the bed was comfortable. It was within walking distance of all of the action in Barcelona, and very close to the Cathedral. If you're planning on doing more sightseeing and socializing, rather than sleeping, and if you're looking for a clean, safe place to sleep in the heart of the city, I'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious and great location”
Reviews.Author: Gorgeous2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 02. For us it was a little gem of a hotel. All we were looking for was somewhere clean to lay our heads. Very basic - no tv, hairdryer ect and you wouldn't want to spend the day there but our room was spotless and very spacious. It's located a short hop and a skip away from the centre of the Ramblas, Plaça Reial and not much further to the Barri Gotic in the opposite direction. If you've got a spare weekend and want to see everything Barcelona has to offer by day and night, it's a great place to use as a base to crash.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Rey Don Jaime I
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Jaume I, 11 | Barrio Gótico, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
